objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: Author and publisher of the report, which includes analysis, indicators, and a YARA rule (meta author "NCSC").

objects.name: C2 domain
objects.description: Primary C2 domain used by Hexed Noodle (AppleSeed Android) for beaconing, tasking, and exfiltration over HTTP.

objects.name: C2 domain (alternate)
objects.description: Additional C2 domain listed in the report's indicators of compromise for Hexed Noodle.

objects.name: C2 beacon URL
objects.description: Example device information beacon sent every 60 seconds by Hexed Noodle to the C2 server.

objects.name: C2 exfiltration URL
objects.description: Example exfiltration/upload request to the C2 server with p2 indicating file origin.

objects.name: C2 tasking URL
objects.description: Example tasking request sent by Hexed Noodle to retrieve commands.

objects.name: C2 task acknowledgement URL
objects.description: Example task acknowledgement sent by Hexed Noodle after receiving a task.

objects.name: hexed noodle
objects.description: Hexed Noodle is an Android variant of the Windows AppleSeed backdoor. It masquerades as a (South) Korean Internet Security Agency (KISA) mobile security application, targets security‑conscious South Korean users, and requires user installation with dangerous permissions. It establishes three primary tasks: periodic command beaconing to fetch tasking, an SMS monitor to collect incoming and stored SMS, and a file monitor to collect files modified within the last week based on targeted extensions. It supports tasks including prompting app update, filesystem listing, fetching files, executing shell commands via "sh -c", listing SMS, purging app data/cache, and sending SMS. Communications use predictable HTTP POST URIs with command IDs (m=a/b/c/d) and parameters (p1/p2), beaconing device model, Android SDK, malware version, and phone number. Exfiltration uses multipart/form-data with a dummy PDF header, a random 16-byte XOR key, ZIP compression before encryption, hex-encoded payloads, and chunking up to ~10 MB. Configuration strings are obfuscated as hex with a 16‑byte XOR‑key prefix, and the app subscribes to Android broadcast receivers (BOOT_COMPLETED, MY_PACKAGE_REPLACED, SMS_RECEIVED, PACKAGE_INSTALL) to persist and trigger actions. The malware uses HTTP for both tasking and exfiltration and enables operators to send SMS from the victim device.

objects.name: appleseed
objects.description: AppleSeed is a backdoor previously used on Windows systems, including in Operation Cobra Venom in 2019. The Android variant described in this report (Hexed Noodle) shares a predictable HTTP POST URI scheme with some Windows AppleSeed variants and uses configuration stored as hex‑encoded strings with a 16‑byte XOR‑key prefix, consistent with other AppleSeed variants. Prior Windows versions also masqueraded as computer security software.

objects.name: Korean Internet Security Agency (KISA)
objects.description: Organization impersonated by the malware, which masquerades as a KISA mobile security application.

objects.name: McAfee
objects.description: Cited in the report’s footnote as an external reference for the Operation Cobra Venom campaign.

objects.name: dexstrings_plaincomms_obfushex_a9ff1e
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule dexstrings_plaincomms_obfushex_a9ff1e {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Plaintext strings from a Hexed Noodle 'classes.dex'
file"
        hash = "a9ff1ebb548f5bba600d38e709ff331749fa9971"

    strings:
        $exfil1 = "multipart/form-data; boundary=$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$"
        $exfil2 = "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"binary\";
filename=\""
        $reqFormatAParam1 = /\?m=[a-d]&p1=/
        $reqFormatAParam2 = /&p2=[a-c]/
        $smsdb = "slist.ldb" //"flist.ldb" (name of the files db) is
obfuscated but the developers have forgotten to wrap this sms database
filename

    condition:
        3 of them
}

objects.name: Masquerade as Legitimate Application
objects.description: Hexed Noodle masquerades as a KISA mobile security app

objects.name: Gather Victim Host Information
objects.description: Hexed Noodle beacons contain device hardware information and phone number

objects.name: Unix Shell
objects.description: Hexed Noodle system commands are executed by passing them to ‘sh -c’

objects.name: User Execution
objects.description: The user is required to install the Hexed Noodle APK, accept permissions and launch the app

objects.name: Broadcast Receivers
objects.description: Hexed Noodle subscribes to BOOT_COMPLETED, MY_PACKAGE_REPLACED, SMS_RECEIVED and PACKAGE_INSTALL broadcasts

objects.name: Boot Autostart
objects.description: The Hexed Noodle app starts on receipt of the BOOT_COMPLETED notification

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
objects.description: Hexed Noodle configuration is stored in the app as hex encoded strings containing a 16 byte XOR-key prefix – in common with other AppleSeed variants.

objects.name: Archive Collected Data Via Library
objects.description: Hexed Noodle data is Zip compressed before encryption using standard libraries

objects.name: Data from Local System
objects.description: Hexed Noodle collects SMS messages and certain filesystem documents

objects.name: Automated Collection
objects.description: Hexed Noodle regularly scans file and SMS directories for changes to trigger exfiltration

objects.name: Capture SMS Messages
objects.description: Hexed Noodle collects both stored and incoming SMS messages, possibly enabling the bypass of SMS-based two-factor authentication

objects.name: File and Directory Discovery
objects.description: Hexed Noodle contains a command to list filesystem contents

objects.name: Web Protocols
objects.description: Hexed Noodle uses HTTP requests for tasking and exfiltration

objects.name: Data Transfer Size Limits
objects.description: Hexed Noodle uploads files in chunks of at most 10MB

objects.name: Exfiltration over C2 Channel
objects.description: Hexed Noodle exfiltration and tasking are HTTP POST requests to the same server with different parameters

objects.name: Data Encrypted
objects.description: Hexed Noodle exfiltrated data is encrypted, prepended with the 16 byte XOR key and Hex encoded

objects.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
objects.description: Hexed Noodle exfiltrates data using HTTP POST requests

objects.name: SMS Control
objects.description: Hexed Noodle enables the operator to send SMS messages from the victim device

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Hexed Noodle
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. hexed noodle.
